Description: Typical range for pulsed fiber lasers cleaning reflective metals like zirconium; starting at 150 W balances efficiency and avoids overheating due to Zr's high reflectivity (~90% at 1064 nm). Max safe before damage ~500 W based on thermal conductivity (21 W/mK). Source: IPG Photonics specs and studies on metal decontamination (e.g., J. Laser Appl. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Zirconium's moderate absorption and thermal processing
Optimal beam diameter for balancing cleaning efficiency and processing speed
High repetition rate for efficient surface coverage while maintaining thermal control
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient oxide layer ablation with minimal heat affected zone
Scanning speed providing effective oxide removal with controlled thermal input
Number of cleaning passes for thorough oxide removal with minimal substrate impact
Beam overlap percentage ensuring complete surface coverage without excessive thermal buildup
